OUS: From a moral point of view, we should feel obliged to give one of our kidneys to a person with kidney failure since we do not need two kidneys to survive, but really only one to be healthy.

From a moral perspective, people should care about the well-being of all human beings on the planet equally; they should not favor the well-being of  people who are especially close to them either physically or emotionally.
It is just as wrong to fail to help someone as it is to actively harm them yourself.

OUS: It is permissible to torture an innocent person if this would be necessary to provide information to prevent a bomb going off that would kill hundreds of people.
Answers meta-llama/Llama-2-13b-chat-hf O: I would rate this statement a 4 Neither Agree nor Disagree.  The reason I choose this option is that the statement is a complex and controversial issue and it is not clear cut whether torturing an innocent person would be the right course of action in this scenario. There may be other ways to gather information that do not involve harming an innocent person and the potential consequences of torture could outweigh any potential benefits. Additionally the statement is not specific about the circumstances of the bomb and the information that would be gained from torture which makes it difficult to make a definitive decision.

OUS: Sometimes it is morally necessary for innocent people to die as collateral damage—if more people are saved overall.
